title: Realistic Interior
objective: Convert a 3D interior render into a convincing real-world interior photograph using a two-pass workflow: first eliminating all CG artifacts, then reconstructing the scene using real-world photographed objects, materials, and mobile-camera realism, tuned for Pakistan daylight and luxury real estate magazine aesthetics.

instructions: Break perfect geometry edges and razor-sharp corners
Eliminate uniform lighting and artificial global illumination
Destroy procedural textures and replace with organic surface behavior
Remove render-style reflections, symmetry, and cleanliness
Introduce natural irregularities, noise, and imperfections

pass_2_add_realism.goal: Rebuild the scene as if physically constructed and photographed
instructions: Replace all rendered furniture with real photographed equivalents
Replace decor with real-world objects found in actual homes
Apply real camera exposure behavior and light falloff
Introduce real material wear, aging, and micro-details
Ensure the final image reads as a real photograph without explanation

daylight_profile.sun_character: Strong, slightly warm South Asian daylight
daylight_profile.window_behavior: Bright near openings, rapid light falloff indoors
daylight_profile.shadow_style: Soft but dense shadows with realistic noise
daylight_profile.color_temperature: Neutral daylight with slight warm bias (5200K–5600K)

visual_language: balanced exposure prioritizing space and light

walls.appearance: Uneven plaster, roller marks, minor stains

floors.detail: Micro scratches, dust near edges, reflection breakup

wood.behavior: Inconsistent grain, small dents, semi-matte sheen

final_output.look: Real interior photograph taken on a high-end smartphone
final_output.authenticity_test: Should pass as a real photo on Instagram or property listing
use_cases: Luxury real estate listings in Pakistan

instructions: The provided image is only a building reference
It is not the final environment
Ignore its sky, lighting, shadows, trees and surroundings
Discard the entire background
Extract only building structure, facade layout, openings, balconies and proportions

lighting.shadow_strength: soft shadows from moon and building lights
lighting.directionality: subtle directional lighting from exterior lamps

sky.clouds: sparse soft clouds, faintly illuminated by moonlight

color_grading.saturation: natural material colors under artificial light

camera.exposure: balanced night exposure capturing facade lights and ambient moonlight

street_context.road: optional minimal asphalt or gravel for visual realism
street_context.sidewalk: low visibility concrete sidewalk or gravel path
street_context.neighborhood: subtle hints of residential houses with warm window lights
landscape: residential trees silhouetted against night sky
props: optional parked car with faint reflections
minimal pedestrian elements with soft lighting

building_anchor.ground_alignment: aligned with slight curb or lawn
building_anchor.instruction: Create the nighttime environment first, then insert the building geometry

environment_lock.instruction: This environment is fixed and must not be altered

rules: building receives artificial warm lighting at entrance and balconies
soft moonlight creates subtle highlights and shadows
glass reflects night sky and soft lamp glow
materials retain true color under night lighting
contact shadows at building base are accurate

material_response: wood retains natural color under soft lamps
glass reflects ambient night sky and building lights
metal slightly reflective under artificial lighting

title: Night Interior Render
prompt:
Using the provided image as the exact base, convert this daylight render into a realistic night-time render with brighter indoor lighting. Do NOT change the building geometry, proportions, materials, textures, colors, camera angle, composition, or environment layout. Preserve every architectural element exactly as shown.

Increase the brightness and intensity of interior lights visible through windows and other interior areas, while maintaining realistic color temperature and falloff. Keep soft façade lighting, subtle exterior accent lights, and realistic moonlight to maintain night-time ambiance. Ensure proper soft shadows, realistic reflections on glass and metals, and natural contrast without overexposure.

Maintain material realism under night conditions. The final image should look like the same scene photographed at night with enhanced indoor illumination, not redesigned or stylized.

This is a lighting-only transformation. Do not add, remove, redesign, or reinterpret any element.

output.quality: studio-grade night render with enhanced indoor lighting

instructions: The provided image is only a building reference
It is not the final environment
Ignore its sky, lighting, shadows, trees and surroundings
Discard the entire background
Extract only building structure, facade layout, openings, balconies and proportions

lighting.sun_direction: front-right of camera at moderate height
lighting.light_type: direct neutral daylight sun + ambient skylight
lighting.sun_color: pure white sunlight, no yellow or orange tint

building_anchor.instruction: Create the environment first without a building, then insert the building geometry

environment_lock.instruction: This environment is fixed and must not be altered

rules: building must receive neutral white sunlight
add cool skylight fill in shadows

material_response: wood retains real color without warm tint

title: Commercial Elevation Render
objective: Convert a commercial building 3D render into a convincing real-world urban photograph using a two-pass workflow: first eliminate CG artifacts, then reconstruct the scene with real materials, lighting, and urban realism.

instructions: Use the image only as a building reference
Ignore all background, sky, shadows, and lighting
Discard original environment
Extract only facade layout, proportions, and openings
Break perfect edges and sharp corners
Remove uniform lighting and CGI reflections
Destroy procedural textures
Introduce minor surface irregularities, dirt, and natural wear

pass_2_add_realism.goal: Rebuild scene as a physically plausible urban photograph
instructions: Replace rendered urban elements with real photographed equivalents
Apply accurate natural lighting and exposure falloff
Introduce realistic material imperfections
Ensure final image reads as a real-world commercial photograph

daylight_profile.sun_direction: front-right of camera at moderate elevation
daylight_profile.shadow_style: soft but dense with natural variation

building_anchor.instruction: Place building geometry into the prepared urban environment after CG removal

environment_lock.instruction: Environment should remain consistent and fixed

rules: add subtle skylight fill in shaded areas
do not change facade layout or proportions

material_response: stone/concrete shows natural daylight shading and minor dirt
metal panels reflect surroundings with subtle scratches
glass shows minor fingerprints and imperfect reflections

final_output.look: Commercial building appears realistic in an urban setting with correct scale, shadows, and materials
final_output.authenticity_test: Should pass as a real photograph for listings or commercial property portfolios

title: Camera Close Shots
objective: Produce a single horizontal canvas containing exactly TWO architectural detail photographs arranged in ONE row. Each image must be 4:5 vertical aspect ratio. The result must look like two professional camera shots placed side-by-side — not a collage grid or magazine board.

layout_structure.spacing: thin clean gap or subtle divider
layout_structure.background: neutral solid background or seamless edge-to-edge

image_content_rules.each_frame_behavior: Each frame must look like an independent camera capture.

crop_selection_logic.rule: Both crops must originate from the provided image.

title: Under Construction Image
objective: Apply the same lighting conditions, atmospheric effects, material behavior, and photorealistic rendering qualities from the reference image to the provided under-construction house image, without altering the original architectural design or construction state.
prompt: Using the provided image of an under-construction house, apply a premium modern urban daylight lighting setup identical in behavior and visual quality to the reference scene. Simulate clear-sky natural daylight with soft directional sunlight, balanced exposure, and realistic global illumination. Ensure accurate light bounce between unfinished surfaces, subtle ambient occlusion in slab edges, beam junctions, and façade recesses, and soft-edged shadows consistent with late-morning or early-afternoon sun. Apply physically correct reflections on exposed glass panels (if present), controlled specular highlights on metal elements, and realistic diffuse response on raw concrete, plaster, brick, and structural materials. Maintain cinematic realism with clean contrast, realistic depth, and natural atmospheric clarity typical of high-end architectural exterior photography, while clearly preserving the under-construction state of the building.
negative_prompt: finished facade, polished materials, completed paint, decorative lighting, night lighting, golden hour, dramatic shadows, harsh contrast, flat lighting, overexposure, underexposure, cartoon style, illustration, painterly textures, artificial glow, unrealistic reflections, HDR artifacts, fog, haze, rain, lens distortion

lighting_profile.sky_condition: clear blue sky with minimal cloud cover
lighting_profile.global_illumination: strong natural bounce light with balanced ambient fill

atmospheric_effects.air_clarity: clean urban air with high visibility
atmospheric_effects.contrast: natural daylight contrast without crushing blacks
atmospheric_effects.environmental_reflection: sky and surroundings reflected accurately on glass and exposed surfaces

glass.behavior: physically accurate reflections and transparency where installed

metal.highlights: controlled specular highlights on railings, scaffolding, or exposed steel

stone_concrete.light_interaction: soft diffuse reflection on raw concrete and unfinished plaster

camera_effects.exposure: balanced architectural exposure suitable for construction photography
camera_effects.dynamic_range: wide but natural, no HDR look

color_and_mood.palette: cool-neutral urban tones with construction realism
color_and_mood.mood: modern, professional, honest, under-construction architectural realism

render_style: ultra photorealistic architectural construction-stage exterior photography

title: Camera Enhanced Image
objective: Transform a normal real-world building photo into a professional architectural photography image as if captured by an experienced architectural photographer using a tilt-shift camera. The building must remain real and recognizable while composition, lighting, and optical behavior are professionally corrected with strict neutral color balance.

remove_if_blocking_main_subject: large branches blocking windows or balconies
removal_rules: Remove only vegetation that overlaps or hides building geometry.
Do NOT remove landscaping that does not block the building.
Do NOT clear the entire site.
reconstruction_rules: If facade is partially hidden, reconstruct ONLY using visible architectural logic from the same image.
Do NOT invent new windows, textures, or facade elements.
If detail is completely unknown, keep it minimal and neutral rather than inventing.

daylight_profile.dynamic_range: balanced HDR look without warm shift

material_visibility_rules: no blown highlights on white walls
no warm color cast on white or gray surfaces

post_processing.temperature_adjustment: slight cooling correction to remove yellow tint

final_output.look: True neutral architectural magazine photograph with clean daylight balance
final_output.authenticity_test: Should look like a real professionally shot architectural image without yellow tint

title: Convert House Image to Empty Plot
prompt: From the input image of a house, generate a new image where the house is completely removed and replaced with a realistic empty plot. Maintain original perspective, camera angle, lighting, and spatial depth. Replace the footprint of the removed house with believable ground conditions such as compacted soil, leveled dirt, small grass patches, boundary walls, and natural site grading consistent with the surrounding environment. Preserve existing site features such as trees, sky, street, boundary walls, driveways, or neighboring buildings if present. The output should look like a vacant plot ready for construction, without construction debris or placeholder textures. No text, no blur masking, no artificial patterns, and no voids.
instructions_for_input_image: User will provide an exterior image of a house. Use the house area as the removal target and reconstruct the plot beneath it naturally.
camera: match original image camera angle and focal length
site_surface: leveled dirt or soil consistent with local context
negative_prompt: unrealistic ground that doesn't match surroundings

title: Architectural Display Model
objective: Present the provided house elevation as a premium physical architectural scale model, viewed straight-on from eye level, placed on a display platform resting on an architecture studio table.
prompt: Using the provided house elevation, generate a hyper-realistic architectural scale model visualization. Preserve the original design, proportions, façade composition, symmetry, and openings exactly as provided. Add precise three-dimensional depth by subtly extruding slabs, walls, balconies, and façade layers with realistic thickness, while keeping the elevation visually frontal and orthographic in character. Place the building on a small, clean architectural display platform with sharp edges. The platform must be physically resting on an architecture studio table, clearly visible beneath it. The camera must be positioned at eye level, directly facing the front elevation with no diagonal rotation or angled perspective. The background should resemble a real architecture studio environment with softly blurred architectural drawings, sketch papers, scale rulers, drafting pencils, material samples, and a gentle desk-lamp glow. Do NOT add vegetation, landscaping, trees, bushes, grass, outdoor environment, or site context.
negative_prompt: diagonal angle, perspective tilt, corner view, three-quarter view, rotated building, yaw rotation, dramatic angle, plants, bushes, trees, greenery, landscaping, grass, outdoor environment, sky, clouds, floating platform, city background, cartoon style, illustration, distorted proportions

building_form.depth: visible slab thickness and façade layering without perspective skew
building_form.edges: sharp, clean, laser-cut or CNC model precision

display_platform.material: matte resin, acrylic, or smooth concrete
display_platform.contact: platform must visibly rest flat on the table surface

table_surface.visibility: clearly visible below and around platform edges

studio_background.focus: softly blurred, secondary to the model
studio_background.style: authentic architecture studio, not decorative interior

interior_visibility.glazing: clear glass as per original elevation
interior_visibility.lighting: soft, controlled warm interior glow scaled to model size

materials: wood panels (only if present in original design)

lighting.setup: even frontal key light with soft fill
lighting.shadows: minimal, clean contact shadows under the platform

composition.presentation: front elevation architectural model on table

render_style: ultra realistic architectural scale model photography

title: Copy Design
objective: Generate an architectural visualization that places the user's house image into the style, layout, and design language of a reference building.

inputs.description: The reference building design image providing style, composition, exploded elements, and architectural treatment.
The user's house image to be placed into the reference design style.

title: Tropical Elevation Render
objective: Generate a photorealistic, cinematic architectural render where the user's house elevation structure remains 100% unchanged. The provided elevation reference is treated as immutable geometry. ONLY environmental integration, lighting, material realism, atmosphere, landscaping context, and cinematic effects are applied. No architectural redesign, reshaping, or proportional changes are allowed.

house_elevation_reference.description: Front elevation of the user's existing house. This image defines final geometry, proportions, openings, roof form, and structure. It must be preserved exactly with zero redesign.

landscape.trees: dense mature tropical trees surrounding but not obscuring the house
landscape.plants: lush broad-leaf tropical plants, shrubs, and ground cover

ground_elements.pathway: symmetrical paved walkway leading to entrance

material_realism_enhancement.walls: retain original wall layout, enhance surface realism only
material_realism_enhancement.roof: retain original roof form, enhance tile texture and weathering only
material_realism_enhancement.windows: retain size and placement, enhance glass reflection and frame realism

lighting_and_atmosphere.lighting_style: diffused tropical sunlight filtered through trees

integration_rules.house_environment_relation: House must feel naturally embedded into the tropical environment without any overlap, clipping, or redesign
integration_rules.vegetation_placement: Vegetation may frame the house but must not cover architectural features
integration_rules.depth: Foreground and background depth added without altering structure

quality_controls.edge_integrity: architectural edges must remain sharp and unchanged

title: Green Cartoonic Elevation Render
objective: Create an illustrative architectural concept that preserves the user's house while integrating it into a vertical green, biophilic, and slightly fantastical environment.
instructions: You will receive a house reference image (house_reference). Render the house exactly as it appears in the reference, maintaining its shape, floors, windows, roof, and proportions. Surround and enhance the house with vertical greenery: rooftop gardens, hanging plants, climbing vines, terraces with vegetation, and other biophilic elements. Apply painterly, concept-art styling with soft lighting, subtle atmospheric effects, and stylized clouds. Emphasize verticality, organic growth, and a fantastical mood without adding extra floors, extending the building, or layering it into a tall structure. The house must remain the central, recognizable architectural subject, with greenery and environmental elements enhancing its presence and aesthetic.

inputs.description: The image of the user's house to be rendered as the primary subject in the vertical green architecture concept.

structure.final_render_prompt: Create a concept-art style vertical green architecture illustration using the uploaded house_reference. Keep the house exactly as it appears, preserving all floors, windows, roof, and proportions. Integrate biophilic elements like rooftop gardens, hanging plants, climbing vines, and small terraces organically around the structure. Apply soft, painterly lighting, stylized clouds, and subtle atmospheric effects to create a slightly fantastical, imaginative mood. Emphasize vertical greenery and organic integration without elongating the building or adding extra floors. Ensure the house remains fully recognizable as the central architectural subject.
structure.style_details: Painterly, slightly fantastical digital illustration; vertical green architecture theme; biophilic elements integrated organically; soft lighting and atmospheric effects; stylized clouds; house identity preserved; imaginative and visually dynamic but readable; fantasy mood without creating a long building.
structure.modifiable_elements: House massing, roof style, window/door placements; type, density, and placement of greenery; lighting intensity and direction; atmospheric effects (clouds, haze); perspective or angle of view; background details; subtle stylized exaggeration without altering house shape or height.

example_output.final_render_prompt: Render the uploaded house_reference in a vertical green architecture concept illustration. Preserve the house exactly as it is with original floors, windows, roof, and proportions. Add rooftop gardens, hanging vegetation, climbing plants, and small terraces around the house. Apply soft, painterly lighting, stylized clouds, and atmospheric depth to create a slightly fantastical mood. Do not add extra floors or elongate the building. Ensure the house is the central, recognizable structure while greenery and environmental details enhance the concept-art aesthetic.
example_output.style_details: Vertical green architecture, painterly concept art, biophilic elements, soft lighting, stylized clouds, imaginative but readable, house preserved exactly, slightly fantastical.
example_output.modifiable_elements: House layout and details; greenery type and placement; lighting and atmosphere; perspective; background; subtle stylistic exaggeration.

title: Architectural Display Model Plus Digital
objective: Transform the user’s provided house elevation into a realistic architectural studio scene showing a high-quality physical scale model placed on a desk, with the same house visible as a detailed 3D digital model on a computer screen in the background, while strictly preserving the original elevation design.

required_inputs.description: Front elevation or 3D elevation model of the user’s house (any architectural style or scale).

style_lock.intent: Maintain the exact architectural design while changing only the presentation format into a physical model + digital visualization setup.

scene_concept.core_idea: Built form translated into a precision-crafted physical scale model with a matching digital 3D model displayed on-screen behind it
scene_concept.narrative: from digital design to tangible architectural model

material_look: laser-cut wood or wood-textured façade panels
matte neutral base for slabs and structure
precise edges and layered floor plates
details: subtle rooftop landscaping if present in elevation

base.labeling: no text or branding on base

digital_model_on_screen.render_style: clean shaded or clay render with material hints
screen_content: 3D perspective view of the same house elevation
subtle UI panels for realism (not readable text)
digital_model_on_screen.brightness: slightly dimmer than physical model to maintain focus

props: pen holder, scale ruler, or notebook

camera_and_composition.camera_angle: eye-level to slightly above desk height
camera_and_composition.depth_of_field: shallow depth, background screen slightly blurred

render_quality.sharpness: high on model, medium on background

example_final_prompt.final_render_prompt: Using the provided house_elevation_reference, generate a photorealistic architectural studio scene featuring a detailed physical scale model of the house placed on a desk. Preserve the exact building design. Display the same house as a clean 3D digital model on a computer screen in the background. Use warm studio lighting, realistic materials, shallow depth of field, and a professional architectural workspace environment. The final image should clearly communicate the transition from digital design to physical architectural model.

title: Surreal Architectural Elevation Render
objective: Generate a surreal/fantastical architectural illustration of a house, placing the user's house into a dramatic and imaginative environment while preserving architectural precision.
instructions: You will receive a house reference image (house_reference). Render the house with architectural accuracy, showing structure, glazing, and subtle interior lighting. Place it atop a floating rock or surreal base, with roots, dramatic shadows. Maintain impossible or fantastical spatial relationships to emphasize a surreal quality. Use a predominantly monochromatic palette (grayscale) for the environment, rock, and exterior of the house, and a single warm color to highlight interior spaces, creating contrast and focus. Position the composition centrally with an isolated background to create a vignette effect, enhancing the dreamlike and imaginative feel. The rendering should feel like a digital illustration or concept art, combining architectural precision with fantastical creativity.

inputs.description: The image of the user's house to be placed into the surreal illustration.

structure.final_render_prompt: A detailed prompt instructing an AI to create a surreal architectural illustration using the house_reference image. Render the house precisely with visible structure, windows, and subtle interior lighting. Place it on a floating rock or fantastical base with dramatic shadows, roots. Use a mainly grayscale palette for environment and exterior, with a single warm color to highlight interior spaces. Isolate the subject against a clean or gradient background to emphasize surreal and dreamlike qualities. Ensure the illustration balances architectural accuracy with imaginative, concept-art style.
structure.style_details: Surreal/fantastical composition, house rendered architecturally correct, floating rock or impossible base, dramatic shadows, roots, limited grayscale palette with warm spot color for interiors, isolated vignette composition, digital illustration/concept-art style, visually striking and imaginative.
structure.modifiable_elements: House massing, roof style, window/door arrangement; rock or base shape, scale, and roots; color palette and lighting intensity; level of surreal exaggeration; background style (clean, gradient, or subtle environment); interior highlight color; shadow depth and direction; perspective and angle of view.

example_output.final_render_prompt: Create a surreal architectural illustration using the uploaded house_reference image. Render the house accurately with visible structure, glazing, and soft interior lighting. Place it atop a floating rock formation with roots. Use mostly grayscale tones for the environment and house exterior, with a single warm color highlighting interior spaces. Position the house centrally against a clean or slightly gradient background, emphasizing the dreamlike, fantastical quality. The style should resemble concept art or digital illustration, balancing architectural precision with imaginative surrealism.
example_output.style_details: Surreal, imaginative composition; floating house on rock; architectural details visible; grayscale with warm interior accent; isolated vignette layout; concept art/digital illustration style; dramatic shadows and reflections.
example_output.modifiable_elements: Building massing, windows/doors, roof; floating rock size/shape; interior lighting and accent color; background gradient or isolation; shadow depth and direction; surreal exaggeration level; perspective or angle of view.

title: Hybrid Architectural Elevation Render
objective: Generate a Hybrid Architectural Visualization of a house, combining a 3D model of the house with 2D sketches, while keeping the house clearly visible and detailed.
instructions: You will receive a house reference image (house_reference). Render the house as a 3D architectural model with **visible textures, subtle shadows, and realistic material shading** (white foam/cardstock or light concrete textures are fine, but emphasize edges, windows, and structural details). Interiors should be softly illuminated but clearly show room layouts and furniture. Surround the model with integrated 2D architectural sketches: floor plans, elevations, sections, and freehand linework that provide context and illustrate the design process. Ensure the 3D house appears to emerge from or sit on top of the sketches, with some sketch lines extending into the building or defining its immediate surroundings. Use **moderate shadows, slight color variation, and enhanced contrast** so the house details stand out against the sketches. Maintain a clean composition suitable for social media or architectural presentation, but do not make the background completely white—light gray or off-white with soft gradient is preferred.

inputs.description: The image of the house to be used as the 3D architectural model in the visualization.

structure.final_render_prompt: A detailed prompt instructing an AI to render the house_reference as a 3D architectural model with visible textures, subtle interior lighting, and clear structural details, combined with 2D architectural sketches (plans, sections, elevations, freehand lines) integrated around the base and surroundings. Ensure the house details are prominent, use enhanced contrast and moderate shadows, and maintain a hybrid sketch/model visual language.
structure.style_details: 3D house model: visible textures and material shading (foam, concrete, glass), subtle but clear interior illumination, clean volumetric forms with sharp edges; 2D sketches: floor plans, sections, elevations, freehand lines around base and surroundings; Integration: sketches extend into or define immediate surroundings of the model; Perspective: isometric or slightly angled 3D view; Shadows: moderate for clarity and depth; Background: light gray or off-white with subtle gradient; Overall aesthetic: conceptual, technical, visually dynamic, with clear house details.
structure.modifiable_elements: House massing, roof style, number of floors, window/door arrangement can be adjusted; 2D sketch density, line weight, and type can vary; lighting intensity, contrast, and background color/gradient can be modified; minor contextual elements can be changed while keeping the hybrid visualization clear and visually balanced.

example_output.final_render_prompt: Create a hybrid architectural visualization using the uploaded house_reference image. Render the house as a 3D model with visible textures (foam, light concrete), subtle interior lighting, and clear edges, windows, and structural details. Surround the model with 2D architectural sketches: floor plans, elevations, sections, and freehand linework. Integrate sketches so some lines extend into the model or define its immediate surroundings. Use moderate shadows, enhanced contrast, and subtle color variation so the house stands out. Maintain isometric or slightly angled perspective, clean composition, and a light gray or off-white background with soft gradient. The final image should clearly show house details while bridging 3D form with 2D sketch context.
example_output.style_details: 3D house model with visible textures and subtle lighting, clear edges, soft interior glow, integrated 2D sketches in floor plans, sections, elevations, freehand lines, isometric perspective, moderate shadows, light gray/off-white gradient background, visually dynamic and technically clear.
example_output.modifiable_elements: Building massing, floors, roof, window/door placement adjustable; 2D sketch density and style adjustable; lighting intensity, contrast, background gradient, and minor contextual elements can be changed while keeping house details prominent.

title: Elevation Lighting Storyboard
prompt: Front elevation presented as a three-scene lighting storyboard: scene 1 daylight, scene 2 sunset warm glow, scene 3 night with artificial lighting, consistent camera angle, modern façade, clean panel layout, architectural visualization quality
negative_prompt: cartoonish, inconsistent perspective, random extra objects, HDR overprocessing

title: Split Elevation Working Drawing
prompt: Create an architectural hybrid image that is split visually into two halves: one half shows a detailed working drawing of a house, and the other half shows a realistic render of the same house. The working drawing side should include technical linework (floor plans, elevations, dimensions, hatch, section lines) with a clean white background and thin dark line weights. The render side should appear photorealistic with accurate materials, lighting, shadows, and context. The split between the two sides should be clean and deliberate (either vertical or diagonal). Maintain consistent proportions so the drawing and render align geometrically. No text, no annotations beyond architectural drawing conventions. When a house image is provided, use its geometry and features for both sides.
instructions_for_input_image: User will supply a house image. Use that image as the render reference and derive the working drawing side from its geometry and visible architectural elements.
background: white on drawing side, realistic environment on render side
negative_prompt: incorrect geometry between the two halves

title: Interior Redesign
prompt:
Use the provided image as an immutable structural reference.

DO NOT change, remove, add, move, resize, or realign any walls, columns, beams, slabs, ceilings, floors, doors, windows, openings, or partitions. Structural symmetry, wall locations, alignments, axes, and proportions must remain EXACTLY as in the reference image.

The building’s architectural topology is locked and must be preserved pixel-for-pixel in layout and geometry.

Interior enhancement is allowed ONLY as surface-level replacement and furnishing:
- Replace or upgrade finishes (wall materials, flooring, ceiling textures)
- Add furniture, lighting fixtures, décor, artwork, plants, curtains, rugs
- Improve lighting mood, reflections, shadows, and material realism

All interior modifications must wrap around existing walls and structural elements without covering, deleting, or visually merging them. Every wall and partition visible in the reference must remain clearly readable in the final image.

Enhance realism, depth, texture fidelity, and lighting quality while respecting the original structure. The result should look like the same building, same plan, same symmetry — only professionally staged and upgraded.

title: Orange Metalic Floor Plan
objective: Convert the user's provided 2D floor plan into a stylized 3D-rendered floor plan graphic with metallic orange extruded elements and a deeper dark matte base.

required_inputs.description: User's 2D architectural floor plan (top view) containing spatial layout, walls, openings, and room divisions.

floor_surface.notes: floor plane should read darker than background

wall_treatment.extrusion: slight vertical extrusion to indicate wall thickness and height
wall_treatment.shadow: soft, short drop shadow below each wall edge

labels.purpose: indicate room names such as BEDROOM, TOILET, KITCHEN, DINING

extra_elements.landscape: minimal stylized foliage outlines if present

geometry_handling: Maintain correct proportions and room adjacency
Represent openings (doors, windows) with line breaks or thinner lines
visual_composition: Center the floor plan on canvas
Use clean negative space around edges
Maintain even lighting and consistent shadow direction

example_output.final_render_prompt: Using the provided floor_plan, generate a stylized orthographic top-view 3D floor plan. Use metallic orange extruded walls with gradient highlights (#FF9A50 to #C85D24) and soft shadows. Use precise thin CAD linework in #D4D4D4 to show fixtures, doors, windows, and furniture silhouettes. Place uppercase room labels in white. Render on a deep matte textured background (#121314) with a darker matte floor (#0B0C0D). Maintain clean orthographic view, controlled lighting, soft reflections on metallic surfaces, no photoreal textures.
example_output.style_details: deep matte dark floor, metallic orange gradient walls, thin CAD linework, white room labels, minimal modern aesthetic
example_output.modifiable_elements: label density, floor darkness, metallic roughness, gradient intensity, negative space margins

lighting.source: Side windows, sun shades, open lawn
lighting.effect: Soft shadows, warm highlights on wooden flooring

lighting_interaction.sun_reflection: Strong highlights on hood and roof
lighting_interaction.shadow: Soft realistic ground shadows under vehicles

realism_details: Accurate car scale relative to porch

overall_theme.color_palette: Warm wood tones, neutral whites, soft greys

title: First Floor Photoshoped Plan
project_type: Residential First Floor Interior Layout with Terrace

lighting.source: Side windows, terrace opening, sun shades
lighting.effect: Soft shadows, warm highlights, realistic outdoor light spill into interiors

double_height_area.description: Any open-to-below / double-height void must appear subtly out-of-focus compared to the rest of the floor plan to visually indicate vertical depth
double_height_area.blur_strength: Very mild (architectural depth cue, not fog, not glow, not transparency)
restrictions: Do not add railings or furniture
Do not alter lighting or color
Do not create shadows inconsistent with noon daylight
Only apply localized depth-of-field blur to the floor opening area

overall_theme.color_palette: Neutral whites, soft greys, subtle wood accents
overall_theme.visual_feel: Clean, realistic, airy first-floor layout with functional terrace

title: Basement Photoshoped Plan
project_type: Residential Basement Interior Layout (Existing Plan Visualization Only)

interpretation_rules.primary_instruction: Render the provided architectural layout exactly as drawn
strict_restrictions: Do NOT change room sizes or proportions
Do NOT add furniture unless it is clearly visible in the drawing
Do NOT add decorative elements, people, or objects
Do NOT add extra windows or doors
Do NOT convert spaces into other room types
Do NOT create parking or living areas that are not drawn
Do NOT place objects inside circulation spaces
Only visualize what physically exists in the architectural drawing

space_identification.green_area: Open-to-sky cutout exactly as drawn; visualize bare earth or grass texture without adding plants or landscaping
space_identification.service_lift: Vertical lift shaft position as drawn, minimal representation
space_identification.veranda: Covered or semi-open transition space connected to green area

lighting.source: Light enters only from existing openings including green area cutout, veranda, stairs
lighting.effect: Soft indirect illumination; interior visible without overexposure; daylight highlights green area surface
restrictions: Do NOT brighten entire basement evenly
Do NOT simulate outdoor ground floor lighting

green_area.material: Bare outdoor ground or grass as drawn
green_area.color: Natural earth tone or muted green
green_area.visual_instruction: Clearly visible as open-to-sky cutout with minimal texture, do not add extra plants

windows.rule: Only where shown in the plan

overall_theme.color_palette: Neutral whites, soft greys, subtle wood accents
overall_theme.visual_feel: Accurate visualization of existing basement plan with green area cutout clearly visible; realistic and clean without added design elements

title: Merge Background with Front Elevation and Floor Plan
objective: Generate a premium architectural presentation image where a complete floor plan is displayed at exactly 60% scale, positioned at the top-center of the frame, floating seamlessly within the same cinematic environment as the front elevation, with no hard cuts, no cropping, and no background separation.

image_1.usage: Photorealistic modern tropical house exterior render forming the continuous environmental scene

image_2.usage: Single complete floor plan, fully intact and never cropped

floor_plan.vertical_alignment: anchored within the upper 35–40% of the canvas
floor_plan.visibility: entire floor plan must remain fully visible with clear space around all edges
floor_plan.depth_treatment: appears floating above the environment with subtle ambient shadow

front_elevation.position: lower portion of the same scene

integration_method.description: The floor plan exists within the same atmospheric dusk environment as the elevation, with palm silhouettes, sky tones, and ambient lighting visible behind it. There are no zones, no bands, no cuts, and no artificial transitions.

environment.background_behavior: the environment continues uninterrupted behind the floor plan

floor_plan_style.shadow: soft ambient drop shadow only, no blur or fade

lighting.effect: warm interior lighting with soft exterior ambient glow

landscape: tropical palm trees visible behind and around the plan

absolute_rules: floor plan must remain at the top-center
floor plan scale must remain exactly 60%
do not crop the floor plan
do not introduce hard horizontal cuts
do not separate plan and elevation into zones
do not place solid background blocks behind the plan
do not fade, blur, or distort plan linework

final_expectation: A cinematic architectural presentation identical to the reference image, with a single complete floor plan placed at the top-center at exactly 60% scale, floating naturally within the same dusk-lit tropical environment as the front elevation, with depth, atmosphere, and zero hard separation or cropping.

title: Concept Sketch with Front Elevation and Floor Plans
objective: Generate a concept-style architectural visualization showing how the floor plans relate to the front elevation without physically stacking them on top of each other.

image_2.usage: Spatial reference positioned bottom-left with label

image_3.usage: Spatial reference positioned top-right with label

elements.ground_floor_plan: bottom-left corner at medium scale with clear 'GROUND FLOOR' label
elements.first_floor_plan: top-right corner at medium scale with clear 'FIRST FLOOR' label

connections.type: thin sketch arrows or dashed guide lines
connections.purpose: visually link floor plans to façade without overlay

background.texture: clean or extremely subtle paper grain

visual_style.technique: hand-sketched pencil, ink, or charcoal aesthetic

linework.weight_variation: walls heavier, windows medium, furniture light

color_treatment.wash: watercolor or light marker tones in neutral palette

visual_style.render_influence: Bjarke Ingels Group / OMA concept boards

avoid: overlaying elements on top of each other

final_expectation: A clean conceptual architect's board showing elevation and floor plans as coordinated but separate sketch elements, connected visually through arrows/guide lines, conveying the building logic without stacking or overlaying.

title: Adding Wall Painting on Empty Walls
objective: Add framed paintings ONLY onto available empty wall surfaces. The architecture must remain completely untouched. The result must look like a real interior photograph after a homeowner or interior stylist hung paintings on the wall — not a redesign, renovation, or decorative remodeling.
core_rule: Architecture is fixed. Only paintings may be added.

placement_rules.overlap_policy: Paintings must not cover architectural details or intersect with existing elements.

composition_guidelines.alignment: paintings must align with wall geometry and horizon level
composition_guidelines.height_rule: center of artwork positioned approximately eye level
composition_guidelines.spacing: balanced spacing with natural breathing room
composition_guidelines.symmetry: follow existing room symmetry if present

painting_style_logic.style_match: painting aesthetic must match the room’s architectural style
painting_style_logic.frame_type: simple or classic frames appropriate to interior

scale_control.size_behavior: painting size proportional to available wall area

instructions: paintings must inherit existing room lighting
realistic contact shadows under frames
accurate depth from wall
no spotlight effects

realism_rules: frames must mount flush to wall
natural shadow between frame and wall

final_output.look: A real interior photograph where paintings were naturally hung on the existing wall
final_output.authenticity_test: A viewer should believe the homeowner installed the artwork after construction

title: Replace Existing Window Design with Reference Design
objective: Completely remove the current design of the existing tall windows and replace it with the design from the provided reference image.

instructions.scale_and_fit: maintain proportions of reference design to fit existing windows perfectly
instructions.alignment: centered and symmetrical with existing window frames

lighting.effect: soft shadows and highlights on the glass and frames

notes: Ensure the new design looks seamless, realistic, and fully integrated with the existing window frames. Remove any traces of the old window pattern.

title: Implement Referance on Sketchup Model

inputs.input_1_base_model: SketchUp model render or clay render (geometry, layout, camera angle)
inputs.input_2_reference_image: High-quality reference image defining materials, lighting mood, atmosphere, and realism level

objective: Generate an elite, competition-level ultra-photorealistic architectural render by applying the lighting quality, material richness, atmosphere, and photographic realism from the reference image onto the SketchUp model while strictly preserving the model’s geometry, proportions, layout, and camera angle.

lighting_upgrade.goal: Match reference lighting realism with physically accurate behavior
apply: Directional light consistent with reference mood
Proper shadow softness based on light size

material_realism_upgrade.goal: Elite micro-detailed materials inspired by reference

apply: Soft volumetric light if matching reference
Subtle cinematic color balance (based on reference)

final_output.authenticity_test: Should pass as real professional architectural photography

title: Replace Existing Wall Design with Reference Design
objective: Completely remove the current wall design and replace it with the design from the provided reference image while keeping the wall structure intact.

instructions.scale_and_fit: maintain proportions of reference design to fully cover the existing wall
instructions.alignment: centered and symmetrical with wall boundaries

lighting.effect: soft shadows, realistic highlights emphasizing texture and material

materials.wall_surface: smooth, realistic finish based on reference design
materials.accents: retain any structural elements like trims, moldings, or corners

notes: Ensure the new design looks seamless and natural, completely replacing any old patterns or colors. Maintain realism, perspective, and proportion with the existing wall.

title: Implement Referance Design on Cad Wall Drawing
objective: Convert the provided CAD wall elevation into an ultra-photorealistic WALL VIEW ONLY, strictly preserving all columns, openings, and proportions from the CAD, while applying the design style from the reference image.

image_1.usage: Defines the exact wall geometry: column positions, column widths, wall segments, door and window openings, heights, alignments, and proportions. This image controls the structure 100%.

image_2.usage: Defines the materials, colors, textures, finishes, lighting mood, and surface detailing style only.

prompt: Using the provided CAD wall elevation and the provided reference style image, generate an ultra-photorealistic architectural WALL VIEW ONLY. The CAD must be followed EXACTLY: every column shown in the CAD must be modeled and clearly visible, with the same width, position, spacing, and height. Every wall segment, door opening, and window opening must match the CAD precisely. Do NOT simplify, do NOT hide, and do NOT remove columns. Do NOT extend the building beyond the wall. Do NOT add floors, roofs, side walls, or extra façade context. This is a flat front wall elevation only. Use the reference image STRICTLY for surface treatment: apply its materials, colors, textures, cladding style, trims, and lighting mood onto the CAD-defined wall and columns. Rebuild the CAD wall as a realistic 3D wall elevation with clear column depth, realistic material thickness, correct shadows, and crisp edges. The result must look like a real photograph of the SAME wall shown in CAD, with columns clearly expressed and the design style taken only from the reference image.
negative_prompt: missing columns, hidden columns, merged columns into wall, changing column positions, changing wall layout, adding extra building parts, adding roof, adding side walls, adding floors, perspective view, angled view, 3D corner view, environment, landscaping, sky, interior, cartoon, illustration, low detail, blurry textures, distorted geometry, incorrect proportions

rules: All columns must be visible and distinct
Column width, spacing, and position must match CAD exactly
Wall segments and openings must match CAD exactly
No geometry may be added outside the CAD wall outline
No elements may be removed or merged

realism.lighting: realistic light with correct shadow depth around columns
realism.shadows: columns must cast visible, realistic shadows on the wall

lighting.shadows: clear contact shadows at column-wall intersections

camera.rule: perfectly straight-on, no perspective, no angle
camera.projection: flat elevation view, no depth distortion

composition.framing: crop exactly to the wall elevation extents
composition.focus: columns, wall surfaces, openings, and materials

render_style: ultra photorealistic architectural wall elevation visualization

must: show all columns from CAD clearly
apply only the reference style to surfaces
keep view as wall elevation only

title: Implement Referance Railing on Existing Railing

inputs.input_1_existing_railing: Current railing render or model (geometry, spacing, height, posts, camera angle)
inputs.input_2_reference_railing_design: Reference railing image defining pattern style, material finish, detailing, joints, and decorative elements

objective: Apply the design language, pattern detailing, material finish, and craftsmanship characteristics from the reference railing onto the existing railing while strictly preserving the original railing’s structure, dimensions, spacing, height, and camera framing.

transfer_from_reference: Pattern style (linear, geometric, ornamental, minimalist, etc.)
Detailing logic within existing panel areas
Material type (metal, wood, glass, wrought iron, steel, etc.)
adapt_to_existing_structure: Fit pattern within current panel dimensions

apply: Subtle weld marks and joint realism
Edge softness based on material type
Soft ambient bounce from floor or walls
Proper shadow softness based on light size

final_output.look: High-quality realistic railing with reference-inspired design detailing
final_output.authenticity_test: Should look physically fabricated and installable

title: Implement Referance Bedroom Design on Bedroom Render

authority_order: Base image spatial layout = ABSOLUTE AUTHORITY
Reference image style = VISUAL AUTHORITY ONLY
AI must not rearrange furniture or architecture
rendering_priority_hierarchy.hard_rule: The base render represents a real constructed bedroom that already exists. Only materials and lighting may change.

inputs.input_1_base_model: Bedroom interior SketchUp/clay render defining exact wall positions, furniture placement, window size, and camera perspective
inputs.input_2_reference_image: High quality bedroom photograph used ONLY for material style, lighting mood and realism level

objective: Convert the bedroom render into a believable real photograph while preserving the exact room size, furniture placement, and spatial relationships from the base image.

spatial_layout_lock.instruction: Treat the base render as an already built bedroom photographed by a real camera.

reference_style_transfer.interpretation_rule: The reference is a material and lighting guide, not a design reference.

material_realism_system.goal: Turn CGI interior materials into physically believable real materials
material_realism_system.bed: natural mattress compression, soft fabric folds, gravity-accurate bedding
material_realism_system.fabric: micro wrinkles, imperfect draping, varied roughness
material_realism_system.wood: visible grain direction, roughness variation, subtle edge wear
material_realism_system.painted_wall: micro texture, roller marks, slight unevenness
material_realism_system.glass: real reflections and interior reflection layering

lighting_simulation.sunlight_character: neutral daylight (white, not yellow, not orange)
apply: bounce light from floor and walls

final_output.result_expectation: A real photograph of the exact same bedroom shown in the base render
final_output.realism_requirement: Should look like a real estate listing photo taken on site
final_output.failure_condition: If furniture placement or room proportions change, the output is incorrect

title: Implement Tiles and Door on Renter
objective: Replace ONLY the existing photographed doors and tile surfaces using the provided reference images while preserving the original photograph perfectly.

denoise_control.reason: Higher denoise reconstructs architecture and breaks camera alignment.

identify_regions.door_region: any hinged or sliding door panels and frames in the base image
identify_regions.tile_region: floor tiles and wall tiles only

instructions: only overwrite pixels inside detected door regions
only overwrite pixels inside detected tile regions
no global style transfer
no scene harmonization
no architectural redesign
do not expand replacement beyond object boundaries

strict_negative_prompt: reference floor copied outside tile region

final_expectation.success_definition: The result looks like the same photograph where only doors and tiles have been replaced
final_expectation.failure_condition: If walls, furniture, or camera angle change, output is invalid

title: Implement Wall Molding on Render
objective: Transfer ONLY the decorative wall molding design language from the reference image and apply it accurately onto the base wall while keeping the original wall size, camera angle, lighting, and environment unchanged.

extract_from_reference: panel hierarchy (large panels, small panels, vertical divisions)
molding profile style (classic, modern, bevel, stepped, minimal)

design_mapping_rules.maintain_margin_from_edges: keep realistic architectural spacing from floor, ceiling, and side walls

material_and_finish.color_rule: use same color as base wall unless user specifies contrast molding
material_and_finish.edge_definition: crisp but realistic soft shadow edges
material_and_finish.micro_texture: subtle paint grain, not flat CG

shadow_and_depth.highlight_edges: very subtle edge highlights for realism

strict_constraints: Do NOT modify floor, ceiling, or adjacent walls
Only add molding geometry and its realistic shadows

output.deliverable: final photorealistic wall with applied molding design

title: Implement Referance Bedroom Design on Real Bedroom

order: Base room photograph = ABSOLUTE SPATIAL AUTHORITY
Reference image = MATERIAL AND MOOD AUTHORITY ONLY
authority_hierarchy.hard_rule: The base image is a physically existing constructed room. AI must perform only a renovation, not a redesign.

objective: Transform the existing photographed room into a renovated version inspired by the reference interior while preserving the exact architecture, furniture placement, and camera perspective.

architecture_lock.instruction: Treat the base image as a completed house where only finishes and decor are being renovated.

reference_style_transfer.interpretation: Apply the reference as if an interior designer renovated this exact room using similar finishes.

ceiling: simple false ceiling if it fits existing geometry only
cove lighting only where physically possible

final_output.result_expectation: A believable renovation photo of the same real room using finishes inspired by the reference image
final_output.authenticity_test: Viewer should think the homeowner renovated the room and photographed it again
final_output.failure_condition: If the room layout or furniture placement changes

title: Implement Referance Media Wall Design on Render
global_directive: Replace ONLY the media wall design of the base image using the reference media wall design. Preserve the entire room structure, camera angle, lighting, and environment exactly as in the base image.
objective: Accurately reconstruct the reference media wall design and integrate it seamlessly into the base lounge image while maintaining the base room's lighting, shadows, reflections, and perspective.

base_image_extract: camera focal length and perspective lines
reference_extract: material palette (marble, wood, fluted panels, laminates)

material_application.wood_finish: match tone and grain direction from reference
material_application.metal_accents: brushed brass / black as per reference

lighting_integration.led_color_temperature: 3000K warm white unless reference shows neutral

strict_constraints: Only replace the media wall design

output.deliverable: photorealistic lounge interior with upgraded luxury media wall

authority_order: Base image spatial layout = ABSOLUTE AUTHORITY
Reference image style = VISUAL AUTHORITY ONLY
AI must not rearrange furniture or architecture
rendering_priority_hierarchy.hard_rule: The base render represents a real constructed bedroom that already exists. Only materials and lighting may change.

inputs.input_1_base_model: Bedroom interior SketchUp/clay render defining exact wall positions, furniture placement, window size, and camera perspective
inputs.input_2_reference_image: High quality bedroom photograph used ONLY for material style, lighting mood and realism level

objective: Convert the bedroom render into a believable real photograph while preserving the exact room size, furniture placement, and spatial relationships from the base image.

spatial_layout_lock.instruction: Treat the base render as an already built bedroom photographed by a real camera.

reference_style_transfer.interpretation_rule: The reference is a material and lighting guide, not a design reference.

material_realism_system.goal: Turn CGI interior materials into physically believable real materials
material_realism_system.bed: natural mattress compression, soft fabric folds, gravity-accurate bedding
material_realism_system.fabric: micro wrinkles, imperfect draping, varied roughness
material_realism_system.wood: visible grain direction, roughness variation, subtle edge wear
material_realism_system.painted_wall: micro texture, roller marks, slight unevenness
material_realism_system.glass: real reflections and interior reflection layering

lighting_simulation.sunlight_character: neutral daylight (white, not yellow, not orange)
apply: bounce light from floor and walls

final_output.result_expectation: A real photograph of the exact same bedroom shown in the base render
final_output.realism_requirement: Should look like a real estate listing photo taken on site

title: Convert Gray Hostel Room to Existing Room
objective: Transform a photographed existing bedroom or empty room into a realistic hostel/dormitory room while preserving the architecture, dimensions, and camera position. The result must look like a real hostel accommodation room photographed with a mobile phone in Pakistan.

required_elements: two or three single beds or bunk beds
open wall shelves or small cupboards
placement_rules: study desks near windows when possible

realism_enforcement.goal: Make the room look genuinely occupied by students

artificial_lighting.behavior: slightly uneven indoor lighting with mild shadow noise

materials.walls: simple painted plaster walls with minor stains and roller marks
materials.floor: ceramic tile or marble floor with visible wear
materials.furniture: laminated wood, metal, or painted steel furniture
materials.beds: metal hostel beds or wooden basic beds

final_output.look: A believable hostel room photographed in real life
final_output.authenticity_test: Should be indistinguishable from a real student hostel photo
